# Mailing Machine Procurement

## Notice of Proposed Procurement (NPP)

**Reference**: PW-22-01009075

**Publication Date**: October 4, 2022

**Tender Closing Date**: October 17, 2022, at 2:00 PM (ET)

## Procurement Overview

The Government of Canada’s Employment and Social Development Canada (ESDC) branch seeks proposals for the supply, delivery, installation, and setup of a mailing machine. This procurement is open to all eligible suppliers, including those not registered in the Supply Arrangement (SA) # E6HAL-140008.

## Request for Proposal (RFP)

ESDC requires a mailing machine that will improve the gluing function, ensuring proper and secure sealing of envelopes of all shapes and styles. The selected supplier will be responsible for delivering, installing, and setting up three (3) high-volume mailing machines, three (3) power stackers, and three (3) balances with a capacity of up to 5 kg, as well as three (3) specialized systems to enhance the adhesive surface area.

## Security Requirements

The successful supplier must hold a valid Designated Organization Screening (DOS) issued by the Contract Security Program (CSP). Personnel requiring access to sensitive work sites must hold a valid reliability status granted or approved by the CSP.

## Trade Agreements

This procurement is subject to the following trade agreements:

* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
* Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)

## Regions

The procurement is open to suppliers based in the following regions:

* Prince Edward Island
* New Brunswick

## Contact Information

For more information, please contact:

Julie Barrette
Purchase Concierge and Document Owner
ESDC, Gatineau, Quebec
Phone: 343-551-9889
Email: [julie.barrette@hrsdc-rhdcc.gc.ca](mailto:julie.barrette@hrsdc-rhdcc.gc.ca) [1]

## Procurement Documents

A bid solicitation will be issued through the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) in accordance with the Standard Acquisition Clauses and Conditions Manual. The business requirements and evaluation criteria will be outlined in the solicitation document.
